page.title: 05Freshfield Names & Words
page.content:
{Place-names We found three Norse place-names in our area: Formby, Ravenmeols and Argarmeols. The ending 'by' is short for 'byr' meaning homestead or town. Formby used to be Fornebei and means Forni's town. The ending 'meols' means sandhills so Ravenmeols means Rafen's sandhills. Slack, meaning wet valley, is a Norse word.
{Dialect An interview with a Mr. Rimmer, aged 83, reveals a number of dialect words:
floddies - pancakes thee - you owt - anything nay - no nowt - nothing reet - right leather - a silly irresponsible person sowder - in the southern field
